info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:53PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Delta, north central Montrose and western Mesa Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 652 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Fruita to near Grand Junction to 16 miles southwest of Palisade to 28 miles north of Nucla. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grand Junction, Fruita, Delta, Palisade, Mesa, Cameo, Fruitvale, Clifton, Whitewater, Redlands, Skyway, Escalante Forks and Orchard Mesa. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 19 and 58. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 72. Colorado 65 between mile markers 29 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
